intro: Justicia sonorae, commonly known as the Sonoran false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along streambanks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are often branched and succulent. Justicia sonorae is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in desert ecosystems.
